briefTitle: Safety, Efficacy, & PK of PRX-102 in Patients With Fabry Disease Administered Intravenously Every 4 Weeks
officialTitle: Phase 3 Open-Label Switch Over Study to Assess Safety, Efficacy & PK of Pegunigalsidase Alfa (PRX-102) 2mg/kg IV Every 4 Weeks for 52 Weeks in Fabry Disease Patients Currently Treated With Enzyme Replacement Therapy Fabrazyme® or Replagal™
summary: This open-label switchover study will assess the safety, efficacy, and pharmacokinetics of pegunigalsidase alfa (PRX-102) 2 mg/kg administered every 4 weeks for 52 weeks in Fabry patients previously treated with ERT: agalsidase alfa or agalsidase beta for at least 3 years. Safety and efficacy exploratory endpoints will be evaluated throughout the study period and pharmacokinetics will be obtained on Day 1 and Week 52.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-related Adverse Events (TEAE) as Assessed by CTCAE v4.03
